title.narrative: OECD/DAC; general support to Programme of Work and Budget

description.narrative: Total general support of 530 000 euros to the OECD Development Assistance Committees (DAC) Programme of Work and Budget for the biennium 2017-18. Support will be paid in two 265 000 euros installments; first installment will be paid in 2017 and the second in 2018. Finlands voluntary support is directed to the Programme of Work and Budget as unearmarked. DAC member states have discussed and agreed the Programme of Work and Budget jointly.The OECD/DAC has a central role in international development policy as an official donor forum. Finland has been a DAC member country since 1975 and an active participant in the DAC committee working groups and networks. Finland benefits from OECDs research and analysis work and the DAC provides an important forum to particip ate in international development policy. In addition to the committee work Finland puts emphasis on working groups. Furthermore Finland supports DACs role in promoting policy coherence for (sustainable) development in close collaboration with different OEC D committees. The 2017-18 Programme of Work and Budget advances reaching sustainable development goals of the 2030 Agenda through effective development co-operation. The Programme of Work and Budget is divided into four entities: 1) effective financing for sustainable development results in developing countries 2) effective development cooperation through reviews and evidence 3) effective development cooperation policies and dialogue for sustainable development 4) partnerships for the global development co- operation architecture. During the Programme of Work and Budget the DAC continues to be the holder and developer of the definition of ODA and to develop a new measurement tool TOSSD (Total Official Support for Sustainable Development). More attention is be ing paid to financing for development.
